review_blob: Bottle from City Shop. Pours a ruby brown with tan head. Not a lot of head or lacing but the aroma is very nice with notes of raisin, toffee and cherry. Very malty in the body. Nice beer for cold weather in Shanghai.

On tap. A standby beer for me. Nice spicy note along with some pear. Great foam and lacing and served in appropriate glassware. Easy to drink with some bitterness in the finish that I like. Great stuff!

On draft. A decent beer that can be found around Shanghai. This particular pint seemed a bit off and oxidized. This seems to be happening more often and concerns me the beer is getting old. Regardless its still better than the macro lager crap from the big brewers. The alcohol is deceiving as its easy to drink for 6.6%.

On draft and fairly new to the market. Lost of pleasant fruity aromas with a nice white rocky head in the pint glass. There is a slight note of alcohol but its rather drinkable for being 7.6%. Creaminess in the mouthfeel of this beer is great. A good beer to have on the local market.

Bottle from a local bottle shop called Cheers In. Nice fruity aroma with some cloudiness. The taste is fairly balanced for an IPA but its still a nice beer to enjoy. More along the lines of APA. Well done and reasonably priced for imported craft beer in Shanghai.

Found at the local Family Mart. Probably one of the better beers to buy in China. Extremely cheap. Not sure why its labeled as Premium because its still very low on the tast factor. Suitable for crushing....
Very little to notice about this beer besides its sparkling clear. Tastes thin and watery with a cereal taste. Found everywhere in the country especially at Hot Pot restaurants.
